snippet: The justices, ruling 6 to 3, said that the dogs could be used, but that the stops could not be prolonged to allow the inspections to take place.
abstract: Supreme Court rules in case Rodriguez v United States that police may not prolong traffic stops in order to allow drug-sniffing dogs to inspect vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The justices, ruling 6 to 3, said that the dogs could be used, but that the stops could not be prolonged to allow the inspections to take place.

headline.main: Justices Rule That Police Can’t Extend Traffic Stops
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule That Police Can’t Extend Traffic Stops
